oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How the number of points of an elliptic curve over a finite field containing a specified subgroup varies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaplan, Nathan
Petrow, Ian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Number Theory
Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
11G20, 11F72, 14G15
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We prove formulas for power moments for point counts of elliptic curves over a finite field $k$ such that the groups of $k$-points of the curves contain a chosen subgroup. These formulas express the moments in terms of traces of Hecke operators for certain congruence subgroups of $\operatorname{SL}_2(\mathbb{Z})$. As our main technical input we prove an Eichler-Selberg trace formula for a family of congruence subgroups of $\operatorname{SL}_2(\mathbb{Z})$ which include as special cases the groups $\Gamma_1(N)$ and $\Gamma(N)$. Our formulas generalize a result of Birch (the case of the trivial subgroup, and the full modular group) and previous work of the authors (the subgroups $\mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}$ and $(\mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z})^2$ and congruence groups $\Gamma_0(2),\Gamma_0(4)$). As a consequence of these formulas we answer several statistical questions about point counts for elliptic curves over a fixed finite field, generalizing results of Vl\v{a}du\c{t}, Gekeler, Howe, and others.
Comment: We have added a new Section of applications added, introduction rewritten in order to better emphasize consequences of the main result
